briefTitle: An Observational Study of the Safety of Herceptin Given Subcutaneously in Patients With Early HER2-positive Breast Cancer
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Safety (composite outcome measure): Incidence, nature, and severity according to NCI-CTCAE v. 4.0 of: adverse events (AEs), serious AEs, grade >/= 3 AEs, non-serious adverse drug reaction or causality unknown, AESI (congestive heart failure)
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged \>/= 18 years
* Patients with HER2-positive early breast cancer who according to national guidelines are eligible for neoadjuvant or adjuvant HER2+ treatment
* Patients for whom the investigator has decided to start a treatment with Herceptin SC
* Trastuzumab treatment naive or non-naive (previously intravenous treatment)
* Informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients previously treated with Herceptin SC treatment
